page.title: 14Transport
page.content: The road network in and around the block is very good. Through the middle of the block runs a dual carriageway which leads to St. Helens at one end and the M58 at the other. (The M58 actually running through the corner of our block.) The M58 link is important due to its contact, within a few miles, of the M6 therefore providing the area with easy access both north and south. The railway station in the Junction is on a line which runs from Liverpool to Wigan, taking 17 minutes to Wigan and 31 minutes to Liverpool. The trains are of interest as they are of an underground type with sliding doors. This is to accomadate the underground system in Liverpool. The bus service is a major concern to the residents. The services run to St. Helens, Ormskirk and Liverpool however these are infrequent.
